section.title: standard file permissions
section.para: File types and ls, ownership and permissions, same as Linux.

section.para: umask, chmod and chown, same as Linux
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# ls -ld /tmp drwxrwxrwt 9 root sys 518 Oct 24 13:25 /tmp root@sol10u9 /# ls -l `which passwd` -r-sr-sr-x 1 root sys 22644 Aug 6 18:28 /usr/bin/passwd

section.title: booting the system
section.para: Intel x86 is very similar, sparc is very different: openboot !
section.screen:
ok banner
Sun Ultra 45, Keyboard present Copyright 1998-2004 Sun Microsystems, Inc. All rights reserved. OpenBoot 4.21.x, 2048 MB memory installed, Serial #43361525. Ethernet address 0:3:ba:09:7f:d2, Host ID: 83097fd2
section.para: No grub on sparc, instead openboot loads the kernel.
The init system is identical up to Solaris 9, still compatible in Solaris 10. But since Solaris 10 init is replaced by SMF.
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# tail -5 /etc/inittab #ident "@(#)inittab 1.41 04/12/14 SMI" ap::sysinit:/sbin/autopush -f /etc/iu.ap sp::sysinit:/sbin/soconfig -f /etc/sock2path smf::sysinit:/lib/svc/bin/svc.startd >/dev/msglog 2<>/dev/msglog </dev/console p3:s1234:powerfail:/usr/sbin/shutdown -y -i5 -g0 >/dev/msglog 2<>/dev/msglog
section.para: The runlevel command does not exist, so use who -r.
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# tail -5 /etc/inittab #ident "@(#)inittab 1.41 04/12/14 SMI" ap::sysinit:/sbin/autopush -f /etc/iu.ap sp::sysinit:/sbin/soconfig -f /etc/sock2path smf::sysinit:/lib/svc/bin/svc.startd >/dev/msglog 2<>/dev/msglog </dev/console p3:s1234:powerfail:/usr/sbin/shutdown -y -i5 -g0 >/dev/msglog 2<>/dev/msglog

section.title: user management
section.para: Most commands are identical to Linux.
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# who paul console Oct 24 13:24 (:0) paul pts/3 Oct 24 13:25 (:0.0) root pts/4 Oct 24 14:25 (192.168.1.29) root@sol10u9 /# who am i root pts/4 Oct 24 14:25 (192.168.1.29) root@sol10u9 /# w 2:26pm up 1:07, 2 users, load average: 0.32, 0.29, 0.27 User tty login@ idle JCPU PCPU what paul console 1:24pm 1:02 /usr/bin/gnome-session paul pts/3 1:25pm 3 18 18 bash root pts/4 2:25pm w root@sol10u9 /# id uid=0(root) gid=0(root)
section.para: The useradd, usermod, userdel commands are almost identical, but home directories are usually created in /export/home.
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# useradd -m -d /export/home/emily -s /bin/bash emily 64 blocks root@sol10u9 /# tail -1 /etc/passwd emily:x:101:1::/export/home/emily:/bin/bash root@sol10u9 /# tail -1 /etc/shadow emily:*LK*:::::::
section.para: Solaris up to 10u9 defaults to Korn shell. OpenSolaris and Solaris 11 default to /bin/bash.
section.screen: root@sol10u9 /# useradd -D group=other,1 project=default,3 basedir=/home skel=/etc/skel shell=/bin/sh inactive=0 expire= auths= profiles= roles= limitpriv= defaultpriv= lock_after_retries=

root@sol10u9 /# cat /usr/sadm/defadduser # Default values for useradd. Changed Sun Oct 24 14:34:54 2010
defgroup=1 defgname=other defparent=/home defskel=/etc/skel defshell=/bin/sh definact=0 defexpire= defauthorization= defrole= defprofile= defproj=3 defprojname=default deflimitpriv= defdefaultpriv= deflock_after_retries=
section.para: The /etc/skel directory and the su are identical, but sudo is not installed by default.
section.screen: t@sol10u9 /# ls -la /etc/skel/ total 20 drwxr-xr-x 2 root sys 512 Sep 11 14:55 . drwxr-xr-x 87 root sys 4608 Oct 24 14:29 .. -rw-r--r-- 1 root other 144 Aug 6 15:11 .profile -rw-r--r-- 1 root sys 136 Aug 6 15:11 local.cshrc -rw-r--r-- 1 root sys 157 Aug 6 15:11 local.login -rw-r--r-- 1 root sys 174 Aug 6 15:11 local.profile
section.para: Starting from Solaris 11 rbac is used by default, with the root user as a role!
